author: wsjcom
title: Asset Growth in the World’s Largest Money-Market Fund Slows Sharply
text:
SHANGHAI—Asset growth in the world’s largest money-market fund hit a plateau at the end of 2017, following a series of measures by the fund’s manager to control its swelling size.
The fund known as Yu’e Bao, whose name means “leftover treasure” in Mandarin, had assets of 1.58 trillion yuan ($251.2 billion) at the end of 2017, according to its manager, Tianhong Asset Management Co. While the fund was nearly twice its size from a year ago, it grew just 1% from the end of September, the data showed.
